column4: UK cost agency queries value of $700 000-a-year Alexion drug
column5: LONDON An enzyme treatment from Alexion Pharmaceuticals costing 491 992 pounds ($704 630) a year may be worth using in babies with a rare disorder but does not represent good value for all patients  Britain's healthcare cost watchdog said.

column4: Exclusive: Amazon expanding deliveries by its 'on-demand' drivers
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc  is quietly inviting drivers for its new "on-demand" delivery service to handle its standard packages  as the online retailer known for low prices and razor-thin profit margins looks to speed up delivery times and tamp down its growing multi-billion dollar logistics bill. | Video

column4: Amazon.com to open new fulfillment center in UK
column5: LONDON Amazon.com said on Thursday it planned to open a new fulfillment center in Britain  creating 500 new jobs over three years  as the e-commerce company expands its European business.

column4: Amazon.com to open new fulfillment centre in UK
column5: LONDON  Feb 18 Amazon.com said on Thursday it planned to open a new fulfillment centre in Britain  creating 500 new jobs over three years  as the e-commerce company expands its European business.

column4: Apple Pay takes on China's internet kings in mobile payments
column5: BEIJING Apple Inc launched its mobile payment system in China on Thursday in a bid to convince the hundreds of millions of users of the country's entrenched  dominant services to switch. | Video

column4: Republicans chide Apple over order on shooter's phone
column5: WASHINGTON Prominent Republicans criticized Apple Inc  on Wednesday for opposing a government request for help hacking into an iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino attackers  calling the issue tough but important to boosting national security. | Video

column4: Apple CEO opposes court order to help FBI unlock iPhone
column5: Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook said his company opposed a demand from a U.S. judge to help the FBI break into an iPhone recovered from one of the San Bernardino shooters. | Video

column4: Dish net income tumbles in 2015 as subscribers drop; shares slump
column5: Dish Network Corp  reported lower net income in 2015 from a year earlier amid a drop in pay-TV subscriptions and a wireless airwaves auction-related expense  sending its shares down more than 4 percent on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 5-Dish net income tumbles in 2015 as subscribers drop; shares slump
column5: * Exited 2015 with about 13.9 mln pay-TV subscribers   (Adds executive comments  updates Craig Moffett's subscriber estimates in ninth paragraph.)

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Dish 2015 earnings fall as subscribers decline; shares drop
column5: Feb 18 Satellite TV company Dish Network Corp's  earnings dropped in 2015  hurt by a decline in pay-TV subscribers and a wireless airwaves auction-related expense  sending its shares down more than 3 percent in early trading on Thursday.

column4: Satellite TV company Dish's revenue rises 3.4 pct in 2015
column5: Feb 18 Dish Network Corp reported a 3.4 percent rise in full-year revenue  helped by higher revenue per user in its core pay-TV business.

column4: Banks build ETF businesses as growth stalls in bond trading
column5: Feb 18 Wall Street banks are ramping up businesses that trade exchange-traded funds full of bonds  a bright spot of growth at an otherwise bleak time for trading but one that may carry unappreciated risk.

column4: Boeing engineers overwhelmingly back new labor contracts
column5: Boeing Co's  engineers' union ratified six-year labor contracts by a wide margin on Wednesday  a vote that ensures stability during a period when the planemaker is bringing out new versions of its two most profitable jetliners  the 737 and the 777.

column5: Alabama cannot use $58.5 million of BP oil spill settlement money on a coastal hotel and conference center project previously approved by federal and state trustees  a U.S. district court judge has ruled.

column4: Fitch Rates General Motors' Proposed Notes 'BBB-'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  February 18 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a rating of 'BBB-' to  General Motors Company's (GM) proposed issuance of $2 billion in senior  unsecured notes. The Issuer Default Rating (IDR) for GM is 'BBB-' and its Rating  Outlook is Stable. A full list of the ratings of GM and its subsidiaries is included at the end of  this release. column4: Finland's Kone looks for service growth with IBM cloud deal
column5: HELSINKI  Feb 19 Finnish elevator maker Kone Oyj  on Friday said it would start using IBM's  cloud-based data analysis software as it looks to improve customer service and curb costs in a highly competitive shrinking market.

column4: IBM to acquire Truven Health Analytics for $2.6 billion
column5: International Business Machines Corp  said on Thursday it plans to acquire Truven Health Analytics  a provider of healthcare data and analytics  for $2.6 billion  marking its fourth major health data-related deal in the past year.

column4: IBM to buy data company Truven Health Analytics for $2.6 bln
column5: Feb 18 International Business Machines Corp  said it would buy Truven Health Analytics  a provider of cloud-based healthcare data  for $2.6 billion  the company's fourth major health-related acquisition since launching the Watson Health unit in April last year.

column4: KKR bets on Indian life insurance with 10 pct stake in Max Financial
column5: HONG KONG  Feb 18 Private equity firms KKR & Co LP said on Thursday it bought a 10 percent stake in Max Financial Services for an undisclosed sum  looking to benefit from "robust growth" in India's life insurance market.

column4: BRIEF-Marathon Oil Corp reduces budget  focuses on Texas  Oklahoma
column5: HOUSTON  Feb 18 Marathon Oil Corp will focus roughly 70 percent of its sharply-reduced 2016 capital budget on Texas' Eagle Ford  Oklahoma's SCOOP and North Dakota's Bakken shale plays  executives said on a quarterly earnings call on Thursday.

column4: Mizuho chief: studying European cases of fees charged on big deposits
column5: TOKYO  Feb 18 The head of Japanese lender Mizuho Financial Group Inc said on Thursday his bank was studying cases of deposit fees charged on large accounts in the euro zone  after the Bank of Japan introduced negative interest rates last month.

column4: Nike drops boxer Manny Pacquiao after anti-gay comments
column5: Feb 18 Nike Inc  the world's largest sportswear maker  said it had ended its contract with Manny Pacquiao after the Filipino boxer described gays as "worse than animals".

column4: Nordstrom quarterly comparable sales beat estimates
column5: Feb 18 Department store operator Nordstrom Inc  reported better-than-expected quarterly comparable sales  helped by strong demand for beauty products and shoes.

column4: Lockheed says withdraws protest of Oshkosh U.S. truck contract
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  on Wednesday said it had withdrawn its protest in federal court of a $6.75 billion contract awarded by the U.S. Army to Oshkosh Corp  for 17 000 new armored vehicles to replace the Humvee.

column4: UPDATE 1-Lockheed says withdraws protest of Oshkosh U.S. truck contract

column4: Standard & Poor's downgrades Petrobras after Brazil sovereign cut
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA or Petrobras said on Thursday that Standard & Poor's downgraded its foreign currency bond rating to "B+" from "BB" after the ratings agency cut Brazil's sovereign rating on Wednesday.

column4: P&G needs to be more agile  says new CEO Taylor
column5: Procter & Gamble Co  needs to be more nimble in its decision-making  Chief Executive David Taylor said in his first interaction with analysts after taking the helm in November.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX edges higher  sustains six-week high
column5: TORONTO  Feb 18 Canada's main stock index edged higher on Thursday  sustaining a six-week high  as consumer and telecom stocks made modest gains  while shares in energy companies pulled back despite a further rise in crude oil prices.

column4: Taiwan stocks rise in line with regional peers; TSMC rallies
column5: Feb 18 Taiwan stocks rose along with other regional bourses on Thursday  led by TSMC which hit a nearly 10-month high after its mixed forecast for the first quarter buoyed investors.

column4: Franklin Templeton's Hasenstab says liquidity fears are overblown
column5: LONDON  Feb 18 Worries about liquidity in some bond markets are overblown and emerging market asset prices do not reflect reality  Franklin Templeton's star bond fund manager said in a video posted on the firm's Twitter feed late on Wednesday.

column4: Toyota recalling 2.9 million vehicles globally over seatbelt issue
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp  said on Thursday it is conducting a global recall of 2.87 million vehicles due to the possibility that their seatbelts could be damaged by a metal seat frame part in the event of a crash.

column4: Turkcell posts 10.7 percent increase in its net profit
column5: ANKARA  Feb 18 Turkey's biggest mobile operator Turkcell posted a 10.7 percent increase in its annual net profit to 2.07 billion lira ($698.10 million) in 2015.

column4: United Airlines receives U.S. Justice Dept inquiry about mail
column5: Feb 18 The U.S. Justice Department has asked United Continental Holdings Inc for documents and oral testimony related to its contract to carry mail for the U.S. Postal Service  the airline said Thursday in its annual regulatory filing.

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wal-Mart  oil drag Wall Street after 3-day rally
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 18 Stocks closed lower on Wall Street on Thursday  ending a three-day winning streak  as Wal-Mart shares weighed on the market after a lackluster earnings report and oil prices pulled back.

column4: UPDATE 4-Wal-Mart forecasts tepid sales growth; stock slides
column5: Feb 18 Wal-Mart Stores Inc on Thursday reported a lower quarterly profit and gave a lackluster sales outlook as declining prices for grocery products and sluggish apparel demand took a toll  and its shares fell more than 3 percent.

column4: CORRECTED-Wal-Mart quarterly earnings fall; U.S. sales edge up
column5: Feb 18 Wal-Mart Stores Inc on Thursday reported a decline in quarterly earnings as it booked a modest increase in sales at existing stores.

column4: British supermarket Asda Q4 sales deteriorate further
column5: LONDON  Feb 18 Supermarket chain Asda  the British arm of Wal-Mart  reported a 5.8 percent decline in underlying sales on Thursday in a further deterioration of its performance as it continues to lose shoppers to German discounters Aldi and Lidl.

column4: Wal-Mart aims to improve scheduling for U.S. workers
column5: Wal-Mart Stores  said on Wednesday it would start offering fixed shifts and unveiled other details of planned scheduling changes aimed at retaining and motivating its rank-and-file workers.
